definition: Su Dongpo, another name for Su Shi 蘇軾|苏轼 (1037-1101), northern Song writer and calligrapher
Perilla frutescens (Chinese basil or wild red basil)/place name/to revive/used as phonetic in transliteration
surname Su/abbr. for Soviet Union 蘇維埃|苏维埃 or 蘇聯|苏联/abbr. for Jiangsu province 江蘇|江苏/abbr. for Suzhou city 蘇州|苏州
east/host (i.e. sitting on east side of guest)/landlord

sentences.english: Su reading a poem "the wild around the water chestnut wheat demand, strong as a mountain soup cooking shag."
sentences.chinese: 讀蘇東坡詩句“時繞麥田求野薺，強爲僧舍煮山羹。”

sentences.english: Sudongpo believed in Buddism and he was possessed of great attainments in it.
sentences.chinese: 蘇東坡信仰佛教，對佛學頗有造詣。

sentences.english: Song dynasty literary giant who exclaimed, "Huainan Xinyang tea first."
sentences.chinese: 宋朝大文豪蘇東坡曾經齰舌“淮南茶信陽第一”。

sentences.english: Three-su Temple is the former residence of SU Dongpo, an eminent writer of the Song Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 三蘇祠是我國北宋大文豪蘇東坡的故居。

sentences.english: Satisfactorily, Sudongpo went back and told his younger sister the thing.
sentences.chinese: 蘇東坡滿意而歸，與小妹言及此事。

sentences.english: The story of Su Tungpo is essentially the story of a mind.
sentences.chinese: 蘇東坡一生的經歷，根本是他本性的自然流露。

sentences.english: Then he launched into an emotional recitation of a poem by Su Dongpo from the Song Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 然後，他開始背誦蘇東坡的一段詩歌。

sentences.english: She is keen on reading books and SuTungpo is her favorite poet.
sentences.chinese: 他樂於讀書，蘇東坡是他最喜的詞。

sentences.english: In just dozens of characters, his emotions and sentiments were all let go.
sentences.chinese: 幾十個字，把蘇東坡的情感一下子宣泄出來。

sentences.english: And yet that might miss the sum total of what made up Su Tungpo.
sentences.chinese: 可是這些也許還不足以勾繪出蘇東坡的全貌。

definition: Su Shi (1037-1101), also known as Su Dongpo 蘇東坡|苏东坡[Su1 Dong1 po1] northern Song Dynasty writer and calligrapher/one of the Three Su father and sons 三蘇|三苏[San1 Su1] and one of the Eight Giants of Tang and Song Prose 唐宋八大家[Tang2 Song4 Ba1 Da4 jia1]
Dongpo District of Meishan City 眉山市[Mei2 shan1 Shi4], Sichuan
Ouyang Xiu (1007-1072), Northern Song dynasty prose writer and historian
Huang Tingjian (1045-1105), Song poet and calligrapher
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
to inscribe a poem (often, composed on the spot) on a painting, fan or ceramic bowl etc as a work of calligraphy/an inscribed poem
